bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Gwen Harvey, October 31, 1953

div1.p: Hench informs Harvey that he and his family have been watching the television program "You Are There," which presented a show on the conquest of yellow fever. He would like to borrow the film to show to others if possible.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Gwen Harvey, October 31, 1953
div1.opener:
October 31, 1953
Miss Gwen Harvey
Program Director
WCCO-TV
Radio City
Minneapolis, Minnesota
My dear Miss Harvey:
div1.p:
Your name was given to me by Mr. Cal Smith, Manager of our local televi-
sion station, KROC-TV

My family and I have been viewing with interest the excellent program on
Sunday afternoon, entitled “You Are There.” Early this summer one of
these presentations concerned the conquest of yellow fever and the work
of the U. S. Army Yellow Fever Board in Cuba. I assume that these pre-
sentations are on 16 mm. film, presumably with sound. The particular
program I refer to was telecast on May 17, 1953, Channel 4, at 4 p.m.
I think the sponsors were announced as “America's Electric Light and
Power Companies.”

For about 15 years my main hobby has been to track down the complete
story of the conquest of yellow fever. I have written a number of
articles on it, visited Havana several times, interviewed the survivors
of the experiments, etc. My colleagues at the Mayo Clinic have followed
this work with sympathetic interest.

Would it be possible for me to borrow this film, either to show privately
to a small group of friends and members of the Mayo Clinic Staff, or per-
haps even to show at some larger meeting? Some months ago I attended the
dedication by the Cuban Government of “Camp Lazear” just outside of Havana
where Walter Reed and colleagues did their work. I have been asked to
describe the dedicatory ceremonies before the staff of the Mayo Clinic.
It occurred to me that perhaps a showing of this film would be an ex-
cellent prelude to my description of the dedication ceremonies as this
film would show in excellent fashion the significance of the place. Is
there a rental on this film or could it be borrowed for two or three days,
gratis?
div1.closer: Sincerely yours, P. S. Hench, M.D. PSH:alc
